The Omega Rail™ comes standard with three black ladders to protect the 1913 rails as well as the shooters hand. The Ladders are constructed from santoprene, which can handle heat up to 350 degrees.

postcontent:
Glock 17. Professionally modified, not a hack job in any way. Has a full 360 degree stipple treatment done on grip surface, fine/ medium texture, has support hand index stippling as well as an under cut trigger guard with one of the finger grooves removed and the other slightly re-shaped, and the back strap has been lightly re-shaped to remove some of the infamous "Glock hump" so many people do not like.  Everyone that has handled this pistol says it is by far the most comfortable shooting Glock they have had experience with. The stippling offers a much more positive grip than the standard factory surface, regardless of your hands being sweaty, wet etc.
   Pistol also has a full trigger job with a Ghost 4.5lb connector, all key pieces of firing mechanism are fully polished, along with the feed ramp.
   Comes with 2 Glock 17rd magazines, factory case, lock and all paperwork as well. I can also include approx 250rds of 115gr FMJ for a good price as well or if the trade is worth it.

title: For Sale:  URX Wrench Tool and Service
postcontent: This is the best URX wrench money can buy!!! We have installed many of these forends- broke Knight's tool and came up with our own design.  This tool is gauranteed not to break. The tool is to be used with the muzzle device and gas block removed from the barrel.  Thread forend onto upper reciever, push barrel into reciever, slide barrel nut over barrel, apply 242 blue lock-tite to nut and tighten by hand, tighten barrel nut with tool- torque to 50 ft lbs. , Install gas block/ gas tube assy, and install muzzle device, install bottom portion of forend and thats it!!! We will also install these for you- we charge $40 for installation. You send us all your parts and pay for shipping both ways!! send me a message if you have any question. Thank You Jeremy!!

title: For Sale:  Palmetto State Armory 16'' M4 Strikefire Premium Carbine
postcontent:
complete rifle ready to go for one low price. The Strikefire Premium Carbine starts with one of the  chrome-lined Mil-spec steel barrels in the versatile M4 profile, mated to our forged aluminum upper, and finished off with a standard carbine hand guard, Pinned f-marked front sight post and A2 Flash hider.  The forged lower is built with our 6 position Mil-spec size 7075 buffer tube and PSA M4 stock, Standard PSA lower parts kit with A2 Grip and aluminum trigger guard.  The rifle is comes complete with a Magpul rear back up sight and Vortex Strikefire red dot optic.  It comes with one 30 Round D&H Magazine (where allowed by law) so all you have to provide is the ammo to start having fun.

Barrel:  16" chrome-lined mil-spec chrome moly vanadium barrel, chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 twist, M4 barrel extension, and a carbine gas system.   M4 style profile is phosphate coated to mil-specs, and is High Pressure tested, and Magnetic Particle inspected, to ensure quality and dependability.   Barrel is made by FN Manufacturing here in Columbia, and finished off with a standard carbine hand guard, pinned f-marked front sight post, and A2 flash hider.

Upper: Forged 7075-T6 A3 AR upper is made to MIL-SPECS and hard coat anodized black for durability. Featuring machined T marks, and a mil-spec finish. These uppers are made right here in the USA by a mil-spec manufacturer, and are marked with the Palmetto State Armory logo on the left side, up front, just below the rail.

Bolt Carrier Group: Bolt is made of Mil-spec Carpenter 158 steel, Shot peened, and MPI. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. M-16 style bolt carrier is parkerized outside, chrome lined inside.  Charging handle is crafted of 7075 aluminum to mil-specs.

Lower:  These forged lowers are quality made using 7075-T6 aluminum and are marked "MULTI" for caliber.  Finish is Black Hardcoat Anodize per MIL-8625 Type 3 class 2.  7075 aluminum Mil-spec sized buffer tube is dry film lube coated on the inside, has 6 adjustment positions, is paired with a PSA M4 stock and has a staked castle nut. M900A
The M900A attaches by means of an integral Swing-Lever™ rail clamp to long guns equipped with a Picatinny rail on the underside of the forend. This WeaponLight produces a brilliant beam configured for close- to medium-range applications, and also features two low-output navigation lights available in white, red, or blue. Primary beam output is 125 lumens for one-hour of runtime using an MN10 lamp assembly (included) or 225 lumens for 20 minutes using an MN11 lamp assembly (included). The M900A has four primary beam switches: two momentary-on pressure pads to activate the main light (one on each side for ambidextrous operation), a constant-on rotary switch for the main light, and a system-disable switch that locks all lights in the OFF position to prevent accidental activation during covert operations, transport, or storage. The navigation lights are operated by a momentary-on pressure pad thumb switch. Available in Black and Desert Sand. 

[NSN--black body, blue nav lights: 6230-01-572-1920] [NSN--black body, red nav lights: 1005-01-529-4968] NSN--black body, white nav lights: 1005-01-529-4970]

title: For Sale:  Stainless Steel Ruger MKIII Hunter .22
postcontent:
I am selling my Ruger MKIII HUNTER in stainless steel.  Don't want to, but I have to. If you know these guns, then I shouldn't have to say anything.  If you don't know these jewels, then I could say it's a helluva tack driver that takes everything you feed through it flawlessly.  But then I could say that it's a super accurate .22's pistol... or... I could say it's a great trainer to put cheap ammo down range with... OR, I could say it's a gun to get your James Bond on with (threaded suppressor, laser red dot scope mounted on the rails, and etcetera.).  

I could say all of that (and probably more) and be right on all counts.  But the worst thing I can say about this gun is that selling it is MY LOSS and your gain.  There's a reason that these guns are CONSISTENTLY out of stock online and everywhere else, especially the Hunter models.

Keep in mind that this Ruger MKIII is the HUNTER model, a different beast from the 22/45.  I've had two of the 22/45's before and thought they were great.  The HUNTERS, in my opinion however, are way better. New, the Hunter models start at 480 bucks but more typically cost in the 560 range. That is, if you can find them as they're usually sold out/unavailable.

Luckily (for you), however, I have just barely begun to break this gun in.  This one has been my cream-puff and I doubt there's more than just the requisite 1K break-in rounds through it (if that many).  It had some trigger work done right after I bought it and I love the way it fires.

I have everything the gun came with originally.  I paid 580 for this baby at the gun show when I bought it.  The gun in the photos is the actual gun I am selling.  It has adjustable rear sights, fiber optic replacement sights in both red and day-glo green, and the weaver style Ruger scope rails with original screws.  I have the original case, manual, and the two proprietary Ruger keys to lock the handgun when not in use.  Manual included as well.  It's got it all.

Here's your chance... a Ruger MKIII Hunter in stainless... going.... going... 

Wouldn't sell it if I didn't need the cash.  Best .22 pistol I ever owned. 

Call Douglas at REDACTED if interested.  Phone works better for me than emails, but will respond to all.  

Here's the specs:

***********************************************************

A Tradition of Excellence, like No Other. Ruger Mark III Hunter pistols represent the evolution of Ruger .22 LR pistols, continuing the legacy created by the Ruger Standard, Mark I and Mark II pistols and yet incorporating many new engineering refinements. They are simple, rugged, and affordable, making them a great value for any sporting purpose - whether target shooting, plinking or small game hunting.

The Ruger Mark III Hunter includes rigid barrel/receiver connection; automatic bolt-hold-open latch; comfortable, rugged steel grip frame; contoured ejection port; easy-to-grasp tapered bolt ears; and rigidly mounted sights for consistent accuracy. Simply stated, Mark III Pistols offer the most versatility and value of any rimfire pistol on the market today.

FEATURES:
- Patented loaded chamber indicator provides visual and tactile indication that chamber is loaded.
- Accurate sighting system features light-gathering HiViz fiber optic front sight (with six interchangeable LitePipes) , precision-adjustable rear sights and drilled and tapped receiver for Weaver-style scope base adapters (included FREE) for easy mounting of optics.
- Smoothly contoured, comfortable grip features natural pointing grip angle with checkered grip panels providing a non-slip hold. The manual safety and magazine release are conveniently located on the left side of the frame.
- Manual safety positively locks the sear when applied. Also features an unobtrusive internal lock that locks the safety in the “SAFE” position and allows you to safely secure the firearm when not in use.
- Magazine disconnect prevents discharge when the magazine has been removed.
- Internal cylindrical bolt construction: ensures permanent alignment and higher accuracy potential than conventional moving-slide designs.
- Includes two magazines and hard plastic case.

SPECIFICATIONS:
- Caliber: .22 LR
- Material: Stainless Steel
- Rear Sight: Adjustable
- Barrel Length: 6.88"
- Length: 11.12"
- Width: 1.20"

- Capacity: 10
- Finish: Satin Stainless Steel
- Front Sight: Fiber Optic
- Barrel Style: Fluted Target
- Height: 5.50"
- Weight: 41.00 oz.
- Grooves: 6
- Frame:  Stainless Steel
- Grips: polymer
- MA Approved & Certified: Yes
- CA Approved & Certified: Yes

title: For Sale:  Bersa BP9cc 9mm w/2 8rd mags
location: Youngsville, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
The Bersa Pistol 9mm Concealed Carry is a polymer-frame striker-fired pistol with a feature set tailored to meet the needs of shooters who want a shootable pistol that's also easy to carry. This pistol has a black steel slide and a 3.3-inch barrel cut with polygonal rifling. The trigger is the best striker fired single stack 9mm trigger I have found yet. Extremely comfortable. Check out a review at http://www.americanrifleman.org/articles/bersa-bp9cc-9mm-review/.

"The new Bersa BP9cc pistol fills an important niche many manufacturers of polymer pistols have currently overlooked or passed by. Although a certain peace of mind comes with having upwards of 15 rounds of ammunition on board and ready to launch, double-stack medium frame pistols are not always a good fit in a shooter's hand. Pocket 9s are easily concealed, but at the price of trimming away the features needed for comfortable practice sessions.

The design of BP9cc provides a pistol that successfully splits the difference. It has the handling and tactical features of a medium-frame pistol, while providing the slim grip of a pocket pistol. When you add to this the exceptional trigger, a lifetime service contract and the reasonable price, the BP9cc becomes a defensive option well worth checking out."

title: For Sale/Trade:  walther model 4 1st variant
postcontent:
produced by Theodor Kommer Waffenfabrik GmbH, Zella Mehlis. It is almost an exact copy of the Belgian, FN Browning Model 1910.
  the Kommer Model 4 is not a commonly encountered vintage pistol. From what I have read it is believed to had gone into production about 1930 and ceased in 1940 with only a small quantity made during this period. A very difficult pistol to locate for ones vintage pistol collection. Right slide is blank.  Left side is stamped: Waffen Fabrik Kommer Zella-Mehlis Kal 7.65  Only other markings on handgun is the serial # on left trigger guard: 15,xxx  Of interest there are sights both intact front and rear with grooving running down top of the slide.  A left rear safety.  The magazine has a rear knurled clasp to release. pistol is in fair shape with pitting and wear. the bore is very bright, with very clean internals with hardly any wear, as if the pistol had sweat in a leather holster for years and hardly been shot. with a crisp clean action.  the pistol has 2 magazines. this pistol was taken from a wehrmacht officer who was captured in combat. 720 620 78 8 4

title: For Sale/Trade:  US Army IOTV Body Armor BRAND NEW
postcontent:
I have a brand new LARGE or EXTRA LARGE Improved Outer Tactical Vest, US Army Standard Issue. These are brand new and never worn or seen combat. The vest inlcudes all of the soft armor, kidney pad & collar armor. These sell new for over $1000 if you can find them.  There were wore out ones on the table at Knob Creek for $350! This wont last long!

Please email me and I will get back to you within 10 minutes. Thanks!


The IOTV is designed to take the weight of the vest off the shoulders and move it to the lower torso. The vest is also equipped with a mesh inner cover that is designed to improve airflow inside of the armor. There is also a back pad in the lower back area of the vest, which is designed to defeat fragmentation impacts to the lower back/kidney areas. However, the back pad does not provide ballistic protection. The vest can withstand a direct impact from a 7.62 millimeter (both NATO and ex-Soviet types) on the front or rear plates (SAPI NIJ standard III), however, the new E-SAPI plates will increase protection to armor-piercing rounds (NIJ standard IV). The IOTV provides, without the ballistic ceramic plates inserted, protection from small caliber rounds (i.e. 9mm) and fragmentation. The soft kevlar panels have been tested to stop 9 mm 124 grain full metal jacket bullets at 1,400 ft/s (426 m/s) with minimal deformation and has a V-50 of roughly 1,525 ft/s (465 m/s). This means that the bullet has to be traveling faster than 1,525 ft/s for it to have more than a 50% chance of breaking through the soft armor panel. These specifications are similar to the NIJ standard level III-A certification, however, military standards do not require their vests to be NIJ certified. This is a huge improvement over the PASGT vest, and the Vietnam era fragmentation vest (which was made of nylon). Both only offered protection against fragmentation
